other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Magis cluster has 64,000 CUDA cores total. This typically corresponds to 8-16 modern GPUs depending on model. For example: 8x A100 (6,912 cores each) = 55,296 cores, or 8x H100 (14,592 cores each) = 116,736 cores. The 64,000 core count suggests likely 8-10 GPUs of A100/V100 generation.
University states they will soon be adding Grace-Hopper GPUs (GH200) to enhance Magis's capabilities, but these are not yet deployed.

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

1) Magis Cluster (Fordham Research Computing): 56 Teraflops total compute power with GPUs equipped with 64,000 CUDA cores. Specific GPU models not disclosed. Based on CUDA core count, estimated 8-10 GPUs total.

The university does not provide detailed specifications about GPU models, memory configurations, or exact counts. The 64,000 CUDA cores could represent various configurations:
- ~9x V100 (5,120 cores each) = 46,080 cores
- ~8x A100 (6,912 cores each) = 55,296 cores
- ~10x A40 (10,752 cores each) = 107,520 cores

Given the 56 TFLOPS performance mentioned, this most closely aligns with 8-10 GPUs of the V100/A100 generation. Grace-Hopper (GH200) GPUs are planned but not yet installed.

Note: All specific GPU model counts marked as -1 (not found) as Fordham does not publish detailed hardware specifications.
